Articles.Content:
This mod replaces all vannila parts with awesome tarnished Skins

PERMISSION IS BEING ASKED FOR C7 ABD DOWN UNDER AEROSPACE, please state in comments which mods you want to be tarnished next.

One day bob and jeb got together and decided to paint the parts, only they sucked, real bad

Download: http://www.gamefront.com/files/21140876/Tarnish+Skins.rar

feedback is welcome since this is my first mod

Simply extract the files to your parts folder

REALISTIC VERSION

http://www.gamefront.com/files/21141005/Realistic+Tarnish.rar

TO see pictures follow this link http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=5386.0
Lets keep this clean here

i think i might rust the c7 pack instead, hey dark how did you exactly rust that fuel tank that you posted on the other thread

Sure, basically I put down a few colors overlayed or multiplied ontop of each other. Each one represents a certain aspect of tarnish.

So first is a layer representing grime indicated by a grimy color. Which could be soot, smut, or dirt adhering to or embedded in a surface. I erased it from the center areas, but kept it around the edges of panels/windows/edges.

Second layer is a dark brown to give the overall color of tarnish with more emphasis on giving the area where grime didn\'t touch. Dripping down from edges, surface features, and general splatters.

Third is a layer for rusty color and feel of oxidized metal. You can see the earlier layers with their chosen blending options popout now.

The fourth and final layer is to help the earlier layers popout around the texture and to complement the third layer.

The blending options mixed with low opacity erasing not only creates the landmark details, it gives the the final bit of pop you want which is density. It also helps to do detailing work and opacity erase around panel edges to give a scraping look. That kind of micro detailing also really brings out the rest of the texture. Of course this took 5 minutes, and is really only for understanding the concept of the art, but was pretty sloppy. It still needs a consistency check and ingame testing. But I hope this helps.

Also @chubbs I\'ve deleted your message, please try to be more constructive in the future.

My stance is if you take a part someone has made and you re skin it...fine. But not release it for others to use as though it\'s your own, even if you change the peramiters. I think even if you have the original modellers permission you shoud acknowledge then in the readme. I\'ve been making my re skin of the vanguard, I\'ll post pictures but other than that it stays on my pc only
